Rulings.Tengu:
●You can target a Limited monster with “Next to be Lost”, but you don’t search or shuffle your Deck. Essentially, there is no effect.
●You cannot target a Token Monster with “Next to be Lost” because they cannot exist in your Deck.
●If the target of “Next to be Lost” is flipped face-down in a chain, the effect of “Next to be Lost” disappears because you can no longer check the Monster Card’s name.
●If the target of “Next to be Lost” is destroyed in a chain, the effect of “Next to be Lost” disappears.
●If you target “Proto-Cyber Dragon” on your side of the field for “Next to be Lost”, you send a “Cyber Dragon” from your Deck to the GY, not a “Proto-Cyber Dragon”.
●You can target Embodiment of Apophis with Next to be Lost, and a copy of Embodiment of Apophis will be sent from your Deck to your GY.

Rulings.Base:
1. You can target a Limited monster with "Next to be Lost", but you don't search or shuffle your Deck. Essentially, there is no effect.
2. You cannot target a Token Monster with "Next to be Lost" because they cannot exist in your Deck.
3. If the target of "Next to be Lost" is flipped face-down in a chain, the effect of "Next to be Lost" disappears because you can no longer check the Monster Card's name.
4. If the target of "Next to be Lost" is destroyed in a chain, the effect of "Next to be Lost" disappears.
5. If you target "Proto-Cyber Dragon" on your side of the field for "Next to be Lost", you send a "Cyber Dragon" from your Deck to the GY, not a "Proto-Cyber Dragon".
6. You can target "Embodiment of Apophis" with "Next to be Lost", and a copy of "Embodiment of Apophis" will be sent from your Deck to your GY.
